name: SolarEnergyPrediction
description:
AI-based photovoltaic power prediction for PV plants. Powered by our industry-leading irradiance and real-time weather data. 
[![Run in Postman](https://run.pstmn.io/button.svg)](https://app.getpostman.com/run-collection/1c42c9f6baae1a51ad9a)

api_methods.name: /v2.0/solar/prediction
api_methods.description:
## Solar Power Forecasting 
The PV generation forecast for unmetered PV systems makes it possible to predict production of a PV system on an hourly basis for the next 4 days without having your own metering equipment or system-specific generation data. 

**Key Features**
- based on quality weather forecast
- solar irradiance prediction based on real-time satellite data
- support of multiple strings, slopes, system losses and azimuths
- hourly forecast up to 96 hours (4 days)
- No AI training required. 
- Ready for usage in Energy Management Systems 


**Usage**
Specify all individual parameters of a pv-plant with query parameters. The result will give a unique plant ID, that might be used in future requests to reference parameters using `plant` query parameter.

[![Run in Postman](https://run.pstmn.io/button.svg)](https://god.gw.postman.com/run-collection/15081091-0b194e23-bda0-408d-b732-03239a67af4e?action=collection%2Ffork&collection-url=entityId%3D15081091-0b194e23-bda0-408d-b732-03239a67af4e%26entityType%3Dcollection%26workspaceId%3D62346650-ac84-4b89-9975-fb61337ec7de#?env%5BRapidAPI%5D=W3sia2V5IjoiWC1SYXBpZEFQSS1LZXkiLCJ2YWx1ZSI6ImQ0MGQyZTA0MWJtc2g5ZGZmN2ZmZThmOTMxOTVwMWRiNjU2anNuYTMyN2Y0NzljMGMxIiwiZW5hYmxlZCI6dHJ1ZSwidHlwZSI6InNlY3JldCIsInNlc3Npb25WYWx1ZSI6ImQ0MGQyZTA0MWJtc2g5ZGZmN2ZmZThmOTMxOTVwMWRiNjU2anNuYTMyN2Y0NzljMGMxIiwic2Vzc2lvbkluZGV4IjowfV0=)

parameters.name: tech
parameters.description: Panel technology used (for compatibility with PVGIS).

parameters.name: lon
parameters.description: Geocode longitude part of pv plant  (required if parameter plant or zip is not given).

parameters.name: plant
parameters.description:
If specified all other query parameters will be taken from the stored  value and must not be given with the query string. 

Use as comma separated list of IDs to retrieve a forecast for multiple specifications.

parameters.name: az
parameters.description: plane azimuth, -180 … 180 (-180 = north, -90 = east, 0 = south, 90 = west, 180 = north)

parameters.name: decoration
parameters.description:
Allows to use SolarPredictionAPI as a plug-in replacement for other APIs.

Supported decorations:
| `default`  | Output will be formatted as shown in example response |
| `forecast.solar` | Output will be formatted like [https://forecast.solar](http://doc.forecast.solar/doku.php?id=api:estimate#example) |
|----|----|

parameters.name: inverter
parameters.description:
Maximum inverter capacity in Watt. 

If specified, the prediction will be limited to this amount.

parameters.name: lat
parameters.description: (required if parameter plant or zip is not given).

parameters.name: zip
parameters.description: Postalcode (only in Germany) - Might be used instead of lat/lon geolocation.

utterances.utterance: What is the solar power forecast for a PV plant located at latitude 34.05 and longitude -118.25?
Can you provide the solar energy prediction for a plant with an azimuth of 30 degrees and a declination of 25 degrees?
I need the solar power forecast for a PV system with a maximum inverter capacity of 5000 Watts.
What is the predicted solar energy output for a plant with an installed Watt-Peak of 7000?
Can you give me the solar power forecast for a PV plant located in the zip code 80331?
What is the solar energy prediction for a plant with a system loss of 10%?
I need the solar power forecast for a PV plant using monocrystalline panel technology.
Can you provide the solar energy prediction for a plant with an azimuth of -90 degrees and a declination of 40 degrees?
What is the predicted solar energy output for a plant with an installed Watt-Peak of 8000 and a maximum inverter capacity of 6000 Watts?
Can you give me the solar power forecast for a PV plant located at latitude 40.71 and longitude -74.01?
